Reviews.Title: “Good value for famillies”
Reviews.Author: Lyn C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week as a family of four - 2 adults and 2 boys 13 & 8. It was perfect for us. The rooms are clean and modern with lovely bathrooms and having breakfast in your room in your pyjamas really suited the boys! Breakfast arrived on time every day and was really fresh. The boys loved the pastries and doughnuts! We had a room overlooking the streeet so there was some street noise but nothing from inside the building itself. The staff at reception are really friendly and helpful and the hotel is ideally situated within walking distance of all the main sites (we walked nearly everywhere) but is also close to the bus routes, taxis and a Metro station. Away from the restaurants on the Via Venuto there are some lovely restaurants and coffee shops that are really friendly and a Spar supermarket should you need it. As the hotel is really just bedrooms it felt like we had our own flat to return to at the end of the day. We really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money!”
Reviews.Author: Paulo C
Reviews.Content: Excelent choise to buget and design oriented clients to visit Rome! Yes, doesnt have social areas but do you really need it? Nice and modern rooms with 4star quality. Excelent and profissional personal at reception desk. Good choise for families and/or couples without concerns about sound isolation. Very good choice to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Bed and breakfst.”
Reviews.Author: Rofupla
Reviews.Content: My partner and I travelled to Rome in February 2012 and stayed at Residenza Borghese. First Day We arrived, registered and went to the room. First impresion was OK, we've checked the bed, toilet and the room seems clean. We went for a walk and came back at 11:00 pm we wanted to watch TV, but the television didn't work. Also the temperature inside the room was a bit cold so I wanted to use the bedspread, but I couldn't as it has marks of ejaculation, how gross. Second day; Woke up with back pain as the beds are uncomfortable and hard. I called the reception in he morning and requested a TV exchange. The lady agreed to send some technician. We spent the day visiting Vatican Museum and St Peter Basilica. We arrive at 10:00 pm the TV still not being repared. I called again and a guy at the reception apologised and said he will send somebody in the next morning. Third day I felt I lose the battle and I am not going to ruin my days in Rome because the useless management do not bother to fix the TV. Fourth day Went to hand back the room key and the guy at the reception apologises again and he kindly did not apply the overnight charges introduced in some hotels in Italy, 12 euros BIG DEAL. We left the premises and travelled back to London. I felt upset because I though we had a great deal, but for the next time I will pay more for my stay and get a great Roman Holiday. A Customer doesn't need apologies, we need actions, if something is not working in the room the Manager must fixed, if something is not clean, just change it. I really do not like the italian attitude. Business means business. In the time we live a small detail makes a big difference and a happy Customer will return to the Residenza Borghese also with a nice review. I am not a happy Customer.

Reviews.Title: “humiliated and robbed”
Reviews.Author: johnpro_12
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the accomodation for 2 nights with my 2 teenage sons. When we returned from a walk on our first day, one of the Managers ( a small man with a mustache) ushered me into our room. He accused me in front of my Sons of having damaged the writing table and he pointed to an area on the table where the veneer had crinkled and lifted. He said that they would have to get the table repaired and it would cost 180 euros. He said I would have to pay this. He spoke to me like I was a criminal rather than a guest. I was totally shocked since we had been in the room less than 24 hours. I told him I was unaware of what happened the table and that the only thing we had used that table for was to have breakfast .(They serve a breakfast in the room because there is no common dining area. In the room itself the only place it is possible to sit and eat is at this cheap veneered table.) He said I must have put someting hot on it. I said I did not recall anything been placed on it apart from the breakfast utilities.. He said I should think about it and he left the room. In the meantime I pointed out to him that the bathroom radiator was not working. He said dismissively that it was not his problem as it was controlled via the building heating system. The next morning on checking out he insisted on me paying for the alleged damages which I reluctantly did. This experience completely ruined our weekend. I did nothing wrong but was treated like a criminal rather than a guest. The Man had the most appalling manner and was abrupt , rude and dismissive. I do not know what happened the cheap veneer table. Perhaps the damage happened before we arrived although he insisted it did not. Perhaps some drops of hot water spilled, I do not know. It was a cheap table with very little value and you are expected to eat breakfast on it. There is no doubt in my mind that I was fraudently robbed and I am making an official complaint to the Commune di Roma and Apt prov Roma. I have also complained to Last minute.com. This is not a hotel. It is a group of rooms let to holiday makers and managed on site. They are not apartments since apartments provide cooking facilites.The furniture and finishings in the main bedroom are cheap and clearly not built to withstand any wear and tear. They are not of hotel standard but rather are like something bought from Ikea. Incidentally the shower outlet was partially blocked judging by the fact that the shower tray filled up very quickly with water and began to overflow. I am certain that if there had been water damage I would have been blamed and billed. I am sincerely advising you to stay clear of this accomodation. It is neither one thing or another. There is a real possibility that you will be accused of causing some damage. For example some things that presently do not work properly are: Bathroom door has no lock and does not close completely. Shower tray as described above. Radiator in bedroom not funtioning I travel a lot and this is undoubtedly my worst experience ever. You have been warned

Reviews.Title: “Good price in Rome, but with a few compromises”
Reviews.Author: Claudio H
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 night in this hotel. Very clean, modern an renovated rooms, though a bit small (understandable because of the low rate). Safe area, near the American Embassy. However, I found it a little far from attractions and from public transportation. Also, there were no wireless internet in the rooms, only in the reception area, so I had to go there to check email. The staff told me they would improve this point soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not good!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: FPA_12
Reviews.Content: I booked this room in November based on the reviews and pictures from the website for my husband and two children. I specifically booked bigger family room with the table and couch because we are a family of four. Instead when we were shown our room I was completely in shock. It had a double bed, two singles pushed together and two cotts and was told this was the family room -the bed was so hard it was like sleeping on a plank. The room stunk of smoke, and when I let the gentleman at the reception know my son had asthma he could care less, and said it was too bad because the room was non refundable. We had a room facing the street, and we could hear cars from the adjacent streets, as well as everyone walking by. Breakfast is served in the room, with only one chair to sit on. You get one croissant, and a few dry rolls with nutella and jam, and some yoghurt with usually no spoon to eat it with. Coffee is instant cappuccino which is pretty disgusting. Coming from Venice and Florence where the hotels lived up to expectations, and the pictures and reviews, this was very very disappointing. The guy at reception offered that we could move to a larger room for $75 Euros, but the room was old and smelled, and the comforter looked very suspicious, so we elected to stay in the room that resembled a family jail cell. On the plus side, the location is close to Via Veneto and not too far a walk to everything else, and the rooms and bathrooms are clean. I would not recommend this "hotel".

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!!”
Reviews.Author: effijo
Reviews.Content: Well, as some of the other reviewers we got a little lost in the beginning until we find the right elevator (the second one!!):D But it was more like funny. The staff was really friendly and helpful. I had to contact them via email before i book the hotel and they responded quickly with all the information i needed! And even if i don't speak excellent Italian they were so patient and kind to me! Not to be misunderstood' they all speak english of course, i just promised myself to use italian only for this trip:P About the rooms. You know those hotels of which you see their photos online, but when you arrive there you are absolutely certain that you are in the wrong hotel? Well this has nothing to do with this residence. Our rooms were better than what we expected. Modern, comfortable and truly clean! Last but not least, the location! 3 minutes walk to Via Veneto and bus stop and 10-15 minutes to Piazza di Spagna makes it a very conveniently located hotel. We could go out in the morning, return in the afternoon for a rest and a shower and go out again without wasting hours and hours on the way. So i highly recommend this residence-hotel and i hope for anyone to enjoy his stay as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Hatty C
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in november after reading other reviews we wondered if we would ever find it, but it was so easy second lift second floor no problem! and i couldnt see why anybody would want to write a negative review. We were greeted by friendly staff that couldn't do enough for us the room was spotless we were given fresh towels everyday and a lovely breakfast in the morning, you could have breakfast delivered to your room from 7am until 10ish witch is perfect! if you need any help on where to go and what to do just ask at the desk and they will give you plenty of ideas to make the most of your stay. Its with in walking distance of pretty much everywhere and if you fancy a change you can buy a hop on hop off open top bus tour ticket from reception. I would recommend this hotel to anybody and confident you will not be disappointed. We will definitely be returning. Please try and ignore negative reviews and have a lovely stay here just like we did! thanks guys x

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Residenza”
Reviews.Author: jamcclintock
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to spend a week in Rome and stayed at the Residenza Borghese while there. As others have said...it is in a large mixed use building that can be a bit daunting the first time you come in. But after you have done it once, it just feels like you are going home. The family that runs Residenza Borghese is warm, knowledgeable, and very helpful. They speak fluent English and can advise you on anything you need to know. The rooms are modern and comfortable and the internet is free. The location is fabulous!! Steps from the Via Veneto and a short walk to the Spanish Steps. The neighborhood is lovely as well. Truly enjoyed my stay and look forward to going back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic accommodation in amazing location”
Reviews.Author: neobella123
Reviews.Content: When I originally booked our stay at this apartment hotel I didn’t read any reviews. My husband read them once I had booked and made me try to cancel the reservation, especially as we were travelling with my in laws and our 15 month old baby. This wasn’t possible and to be honest I am SO GLAD it wasn’t. Our experience at Residenza Borghese was really wonderful. The staff were extremely friendly and went out of their way to help us at all times. We arrived during the day and travelled from the airport with a taxi that Jean kindly booked for us. Therefore we didn’t have any problems finding the hotel. I can see how it can be a bit daunting to arrive at night and have to look for the property. However, it’s really not the end of the world if you have to search a bit your first time. Once inside the characteristic entrance you have to take the second lift on the right up to the second floor. This wasn’t clearly stated beforehand but again, not the end of the world. We were welcomed so warmly by Jean that any doubts we had about staying here soon faded away. The rooms were extremely clean and very modern with tea/coffee making facilities in the room. The size of the room was more than substantial and had plenty of space for the baby cot. The lift is tiny but this is usual in a building of this age. The view from the bedroom was of the courtyard used by other residents of the building (a mix of office workers and apartment residents). To be honest it wasn’t the best view but I wouldn’t expect anything different from a building of this type. At the end of the day it is an old building in an ancient city. I wasn’t there for the view from my bedroom window! The breakfast is served in your room and consisted of bread rolls, croissants (plain and chocolate), cereal, crispbreads, jam, butter, cream cheese and yoghurts. It’s a continental breakfast with no hot items but is more than enough. The hotel never claims to be a conventional hotel and rightly so. The rooms are based in a characteristic building in one of the best possible locations in Rome. We walked from the hotel to most places we needed to go. There are great transport links nearby and you can book tours through the hotel that pick you up and bring you back to the hotel. Jean and Kevin made some excellent suggestions of restaurants nearby where we ate some outstanding meals. To be honest, I would not hesitate to stay here again and will recommend it to family and friends. The staff were so accommodating and never said no to any of our requests and believe me, my big fat Greek family and I can be very demanding!

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE ROOM.. AND A BIG SURPRISE!”
Reviews.Author: Angelo R
Reviews.Content: I had some trouble booking the room with my credit card and the person that mail me the days before I got there was very helpful and kind. When I got there and I entered the BIG building it was very hard for me to find the way to the reception since the rooms are all over the building and there is no sign or anything that tells you where to go. He took us 10 min to understand where the reception was. The room was really good, everything was very new and clean and the bathroom was outstanding considering the price that we paid (72€ /night/room). The breakfast was ok, but there is not enough space in the room for 2 people having breakfast. rooms didn't have wi-fi witch was available only at the reception. The position is really interesting, 2 mins away from Via Veneto and Villa borghese. Its a very quiet area and is not too far from the city centre. The best part of my staying was the check out.. the girl at the reception (I think her name is Marianna) was a real pearl, she was not only beautiful but also very kind, helpful and professional.. she really made my day.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem- great value, helpful staff- and incredible location”
Reviews.Author: 1966Karen
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through an online travel company. The reviews were decent, but later i found one that really worried me- it was completely negative and very nasty towards this hotel- though others had said much better things. I will tell you with all honesty that this is a great guest house to stay in- the location is top notch, the guest apartments are clean, modern, and full of amenities (mini frig, blowdryers, flat screen tv, etc) the bathroom is spacious and had one of the better showers we found during our two week trip to Italy at multiple hotels. Furthermore, the staff- both Ariana and Jean- are fabulous- they are accommodating, gracious, and go out of their way to help you with anything. We traveled with our two children- ages 10 and 14- who are used to comfort- and they were equally happy with this hotel. Whoever wrote that very negative review in the past was very off in their perceptions- really this is a highly recommended place to stay. Comfortable, clean, pleasant staff, amazing location, safe, and excellent value!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in the perfect area”
Reviews.Author: 302chrissie
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 12 that stayed for 2 nights in June. Jean was on top of things from the first time that I made contact with the hotel. She set up a car service to pick us up at the airport to make our arrival much easier. Our rooms were not ready when we arrived at 11:00 am (not the hotel's fault) but she allowed us to use an extra room until our rooms were ready. She was a wealth of knowledge and was able to assist us throughout our stay. This is not your typical hotel but it has all of the accomodations that you will need and more. We loved the area the most. It was safe, quiet, had many restaurants to chose from and a great little super market down the street. The bus stop was only 2 blocks away. The breakfast was perfect and what a treat to have it delivered to your room every morning. I would recommend this hotel and would plan on coming back. The price was right and very reasonable for the area and the accomodations. We loved our room too!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: marysue78
Reviews.Content: Recently we stayed here for 2 nights. We were a party of 6 and had a double room and a quad room. After reading some of the reviews I was a little worried about our reservation but once we arrived and were settled into our room there was no need to worry. Yes, the rooms are located in an older building in a very nice section of Rome. You have to be rung into the building and then you have to take the second lift up to the reception area. The lift is very small and can only accomadate 1 person and 2 suitcases but to me it was not a big deal. The rooms were immaculate. The quad room was very spacious and the bathroom modern and fully stocked . Noise was not an issue during our stay. Beds were a little stiff and probably the one area where I would like to see improvement.. Breakfast was delivered to our room each morning at the time of our choosing. It consisted of pastries,yogurt,tea and coffee. Location was excellant and we easily walked to the Trevi Founain and Spanish Steps. Staff was very accommodating and secured us reservations at Ristorante il Gabriello. On check out morning they stored our luggage until we were picked up by our shuttle. Our stay was very pleasant and the room rate very reasonable. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget accommodation”
Reviews.Author: welshgirl000
Reviews.Content: As said on previous postings, this is not a hotel but a group of apartments with a reception area. We took a taxi from Ciampino airport and the taxi driver took us right outside the building (once we had shown him our map). We had a bit of trouble finding the reception as it is a residential building. For anyone visiting, go to the second lift then up to the second floor to reception. The rooms were very clean and had everything we needed including air conditioning, flatscreen TV and tea and coffee. The bathroom was clean and modern and toiletries and a hairdryer were provided. Breakfast was delivered to our room each morning and was very high in sugar (croissants, chocolate donuts) but that was the only niggle. Our room looked over a small courtyard and it could be a bit noisy early in the morning as people were getting up for work, but it all added to the experience. The location was great, just off the Via Veneto. We did take buses and the metro but found that you can easily walk around Rome and you get to see much more that way. What a delight it was coming across little Piazzas not on the main tourist maps. We also found the restaurants much cheaper on the side streets just off the main tourist areas. The staff at the hotel are outstanding and a particular mention must go to Jean who helped us with the bus routes, information on restaurants, places to see and made us espresso one evening when we came in feeling cold from a day out in the rain. All in all, we can't really fault Residenza Borghese for the price we paid. We would recommend this to anyone looking to stay in Rome on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!!! Stay away from this place”
Reviews.Author: marcoJorge
Reviews.Content: It looked great on the web site!!!! And, hard to believe, it had some good reviews (must be the hotel employees writing). What a horrible experience. When I got to Via Sardegna 55, it looked like an abandoned building. I thought I was at the wrong place, and went back to the computer to verify the address. Unbelievable, it was the right address. I looked at the buzz names and found 19 – Residenza Borghese. As I pressed it, the (huge) door started opening without anyone saying anything. I felt myself in a thrill film, coming into an abandoned dirty castle, through a gallery filled with closed doors. No signs anywhere indicating where to go. I go up on the elevator, floor by floor, and nothing – no one shows up, all doors closed, no signs of hotel. I go back to the main door, now afraid, and press the button again. Now I wait for someone to say something, and a voice come in informing that I should take the second elevator down the hall, not the first one. At this time I have regretted 100% having booked at this “place”. What they call hotel or guest house is 3 floors of a strange building that they transformed into a pension. The “reception” is at one of the little rooms (probably apartments that were transformed into rooms, divided by wood walls). A Japanese lady, does not even let me speak about how afraid I am. Rather, she started telling me how well I would feel in the room and that she would be able to help me with any needs while in Rome. As described here by other reviews, "Climate Controlled" rooms apparently means that you have to open wide the room window that faces an ugly alley, after which you will be hearing your neighbors to fight or have private parties - all night. Remember, this is an apartment building, and, after all these people are in their own houses. Smell of cigarette will come through to your room all night. A/C does not work – at all!!!!!!! The room is so small that I was about to find out who was the magician able to take the picture that is on the site and that makes you think it is a nice decent-sized place. Breakfast is a joke - ridiculous!!!!!!! Croissant and nutella and jam – nothing else. No juice, no bread, no fruit. Don’t complaint, you cannot get your money back. Every night, when you come in, you have to ring a bell (that has a little paper on it saying do not ring, but the receptionist said to please ring, and he would open the hall door) and wake up everyone else on the same hallway. It makes you feel very uncomfortable. The beds were the worst I have experienced in my life. It is really bad, and you will have back pain during your stay in Rome. And if you need anything, like I needed a plate and a knife, to eat my prochutto, they will not bring to you – they don’t want you to eat in the room – so you keep asking and they keep telling you that they will bring it up. Consider this a HIGH RISK place. This place is a series of apartments on different floors in different parts of a dilapidated apartment block. Managed & owned by some amateurs. After you book, if you get here and change your mind, there is no way to decline the charges. Moreover, check out is at 10 am, instead of noon - and they will not let you stay till noon, unless you pay $50 Euros. This is not a hotel. Booking here may cost you a lot more money than you expect, and put a real damper on your vacation in Rome. Maybe the only thing that saves the place is free internet, but which, after all, ends up being a very expensive connection!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: lindsayltownsend
Reviews.Content: We were a bit nervous about this hotel when we arrived at the unmarked apartment building. The setup is a bit strange, I must admit, but the staff makes up for it. They are so incredibly nice and helpful, willing to cater to your every question or concern. It's nice to feel like you are at home when in a foreign country and the staff at Residenza Borghese certainly does everything they can to make this possible. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a hotel in the neighborhood near Via Veneto.

Reviews.Title: “Modern rooms in a discreet, private residence in the upmarket area of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Trixie82
Reviews.Content: Lovely modern room in a quiet residencial appartment block. Lifts to all floors. The room was as you'd expect in an upmarket hotel. Lovely double sized shower with plenty of towels and toiletries. Double bed was in fact two singles - but this seems to be fairly common place in Italy. The room rate was good for the area we were staying in but high when you consider the very basic breakfast. We stayed for two nights and each morning we were served one type of cereal, sweet pastries (too sweet for breakfast), unlimited bread to toast with a selection of jams and preserves, yogurt, coffee and tea. The staff were friendly and helpful and on hand 24 hours a day if required. All in all, this a fantastic little find condsidering, at the end of the road, the room rate would only buy you four coffees and four cakes. It is a very expensive area of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “What a mistake”
Reviews.Author: London_UKRogerJ
Reviews.Content: Very Odd & uncomfortable set up. Rooms are small, dark & beds very uncomfortable. The windows open into internal court yard so if you open your window you get the cigarette smoke and disturbed by other neighbours conversation. Breakfast is basic. This is not a hotel. A series of apartments on different floors in different parts of a dilapidated apartment block. Managed & owned by some amateurs.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but strange”
Reviews.Author: TravelSiMa
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at Residenza Borghese at the end of May, 2010. Location: The hotel is located in a side street of upper Via Veneto. It took us 25 min walking from Stazione Termini to get there. If you are walking from town, it takes about 15 min permanently uphill from the Spanish Steps, and about 35 min from the Forum Romanum to get to the Hotel, so for us, although we are really good on foot, not a suitable location for getting to the hotel during the day for a break within the sightseeing program. In the evening, there is nothing to do around, we felt more like being in the outskirts like in the centre of Rome. Hotel: If you look at the hotel’s homepage you get the impression of a somehow upscale little boutique hotel, but in fact, this is not what it is. The Hotel itself seemed strange to us. It looks like the owners have bought some apartments in a normal building and re-constructed them into guest rooms –the reception is in the 2nd floor, they call it “lobby”, but in fact, you do not feel really convenient sitting there. The rooms are distributed over two parts of the building with other flats not belonging to the hotel also situated around there. All rooms are facing different inner courtyards what makes them quite dark inside. The room itself was small, what is not unusual for a hotel in Rome, but nevertheless, we felt more like being in a prison cell like in a hotel room. Approximately 3-4 guest rooms are sharing the same floor, and every time other guests return to their room, you can hear the floor door slam. You can also hear every noise coming from the inner courtyards. The room was modern and very clean, which was the best thing, but there is a total lack of ambience to it. On top, for the fact that it opened just recently, it already starts to look a bit worn out, maybe the materials used are not the best ones. There is no real table in the room, just a desk, and no water boiling facility. The breakfast is served in the second floor, also in a kind of re-constructed apartment opening to an inner courtyard –they serve croissants, jam, nutella, coffee, juice, flakes, yoghurt and toast. The breakfast was ok, but we missed some cheese to have something “not-sweet”. Taken together, we would not recommend staying here, if you are looking for a hotel in the middle of Rome. It was ok, but somehow strange and not what we expected it to be.

Reviews.Title: “so lala...”
Reviews.Author: kaffeepause
Reviews.Content: First of all, this is NOT a hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! This company just bought a few flats in a normal renting house and converted them in smaller rooms and suites. If you come back from a day in rome, you had to ring a bell and (sometimes they're asked your name etc.) buzzed you in, through the second door as well. Then to get into your room, they had to open the original flat door to let you in and then you could get to your room. How complicated is that!!!!! I had booked a suite for 7nights, it was my birthday and I traveled with my mom and I live in a different country, so we don't see each other that often. SO I wanted to have something nice....... The room and bathroom were nice and modern. TV is only Italian. We had our poor breakfast in the room every morning. The girl who brought us the breakfast, didn't understood a single word and was very moody. The coffee was always lukewarm, two pieces of pastry, two rusks, two juices (very nasty) and if we were lucky yoghurt and a huge amount of butter and jam etc. Which was laughable, because we had only two pieces of pastry. The only table was a writing desk and the tray was placed there of course.My mom used the only chair in the room and I was sitting on the footstool to had my breakfast... Need I say more? Why we had such a bad service, I don't know. I booked a suite for sake....... We got woken up every morning by people who had there offices in this house. They had a smoke in the small yard and were talking and talking, well they're Italians.... and banged the door so loud and often. Two nights we couldn't get some sleep, because a resident had the TV so loud you heard every word. The lady and three gentlemen we met from the reception area, were all very friendly. The house in itself was very nice appointed and so was the area.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable holiday”
Reviews.Author: arifofari
Reviews.Content: Beautiful apartment hotel, modern and sophisticated and really close to all the main sites of Rome. The rooms are spacious and are exactly as shown in the website, the bathrooms well equipped and the staff is incredibly helpfull and nice.

HotelInfo.Name: Residenza Borghese
HotelInfo.Address: Via Sardegna, 55, 00187 Rome, Italy
